intro: Randia bruneelii, commonly known as the Bruneel's randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and opposite, elliptical leaves. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Randia bruneelii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
